verses.verse: that in the dispensation of (Gal. 4:4) the fullness of the times (1 Cor. 3:22) He might gather together in one (Eph. 3:15; (Phil. 2:9; Col. 1:16, 20)) all things in Christ, both which are in heaven and which are on earthâ€”in Him.
(Rom. 8:17) In Him also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestined according to (Is. 46:10) the purpose of Him who works all things according to the counsel of His will,
(2 Thess. 2:13) that we (James 1:18) who first trusted in Christ should be to the praise of His glory.
In Him you also trusted, after you heard (John 1:17) the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation; in whom also, having believed, ((2 Cor. 1:22)) you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise,
(2 Cor. 5:5) who is the guarantee of our inheritance (Rom. 8:23) until the redemption of ((Acts 20:28)) the purchased possession, (1 Pet. 2:9) to the praise of His glory.
(Prayer for Spiritual Wisdom) Therefore I also, (Col. 1:4; Philem. 5) after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints,
(Rom. 1:9) do not cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers:
that (John 20:17; Rom. 15:6) the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, (Is. 11:2; Col. 1:9) may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him,

(Acts 26:18; 2 Cor. 4:6; Heb. 6:4) the eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that you may know what is (Eph. 2:12) the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints,
and what is the exceeding greatness of His power toward us who believe, (Col. 2:12) according to the working of His mighty power
which He worked in Christ when (Acts 2:24) He raised Him from the dead and (Ps. 110:1) seated Him at His right hand in the heavenly places,

(Is. 9:6, 7; Luke 1:32, 33; Phil. 2:9, 10; Rev. 19:12) far above all ((Rom. 8:38, 39)) principality and power and might and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in that which is to come.
And (Ps. 8:6; 110:1; Matt. 28:18; 1 Cor. 15:27) He put all things under His feet, and gave Him (Heb. 2:7) to be head over all things to the church,
(Rom. 12:5) which is His body, (Col. 2:9) the fullness of Him ((1 Cor. 12:6)) who fills all in all.
(By Grace Through Faith) And (Eph. 2:5; Col. 2:13) you He made alive, (Eph. 4:18) who were dead in trespasses and sins,

(Col. 1:21) in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to ((John 12:31); Eph. 6:12) the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in (Col. 3:6) the sons of disobedience,

(1 Pet. 4:3) among whom also we all once conducted ourselves in (Gal. 5:16) the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and ((Ps. 51:5)) were by nature children of wrath, just as the others.
But God, (Ps. 103:8-11; Rom. 10:12) who is rich in mercy, because of His (John 3:16; 1 John 4:9, 10) great love with which He loved us,
(Rom. 5:6, 8) even when we were dead in trespasses, ((Rom. 6:4, 5)) made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved),
and raised us up together, and made us sit together (Eph. 1:20) in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
that in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in (Titus 3:4) His kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.
((2 Tim. 1:9)) For by grace you have been saved (Rom. 4:16) through faith, and that not of yourselves; ((John 1:12, 13)) it is the gift of God,
